Azure Front Door origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default. This overrides the host header defined at Endpoint

priority.description: Priority of origin in given origin group for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority origin is healthy.Must be between 1 and 5

Endpoint.description: CDN endpoint is the entity within a CDN profile containing configuration information such as origin, protocol, content caching and delivery behavior. The CDN endpoint uses the URL format <endpointname>.azureedge.net.

EndpointProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

hostName.description: The host name of the endpoint structured as {endpointName}.{DNSZone}, e.g. contoso.azureedge.net

origins.description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN.

originGroups.description: The origin groups comprising of origins that are used for load balancing the traffic based on availability.

customDomains.description: The custom domains under the endpoint.

originPath.description: A directory path on the origin that CDN can use to retrieve content from, e.g. contoso.cloudapp.net/originpath.

contentTypesToCompress.description: List of content types on which compression applies. The value should be a valid MIME type.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. This property at Endpoint is only allowed when endpoint uses single origin and can be overridden by the same property specified at origin.If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether content compression is enabled on CDN. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on CDN when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

isHttpAllowed.description: Indicates whether HTTP traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

isHttpsAllowed.description: Indicates whether HTTPS traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

queryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

optimizationType.description: Specifies what scenario the customer wants this CDN endpoint to optimize for, e.g. Download, Media services. With this information, CDN can apply scenario driven optimization.

probePath.description: Path to a file hosted on the origin which helps accelerate delivery of the dynamic content and calculate the most optimal routes for the CDN. This is relative to the origin path. This property is only relevant when using a single origin.

geoFilters.description: List of rules defining the user's geo access within a CDN endpoint. Each geo filter defines an access rule to a specified path or content, e.g. block APAC for path /pictures/

defaultOriginGroup.description: A reference to the origin group.

urlSigningKeys.description: List of keys used to validate the signed URL hashes.

DeliveryRuleAction.description: An action for the delivery rule.

UrlRedirectAction.description: Defines the url redirect action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

UrlRedirectActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the url redirect action.

redirectType.description: The redirect type the rule will use when redirecting traffic.

destinationProtocol.description: Protocol to use for the redirect. The default value is MatchRequest

customPath.description: The full path to redirect. Path cannot be empty and must start with /. Leave empty to use the incoming path as destination path.

customHostname.description: Host to redirect. Leave empty to use the incoming host as the destination host.

customQueryString.description: The set of query strings to be placed in the redirect URL. Setting this value would replace any existing query string; leave empty to preserve the incoming query string. Query string must be in <key>=<value> format. ? and & will be added automatically so do not include them.

customFragment.description: Fragment to add to the redirect URL. Fragment is the part of the URL that comes after #. Do not include the #.

queryParameters.description: query parameters to include or exclude (comma separated).

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether content compression is enabled. If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on AzureFrontDoor when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

cacheDuration.description: The duration for which the content needs to be cached. Allowed format is [d.]hh:mm:ss

transform.description: Describes what transforms are applied before matching

DeepCreatedOrigin.description: The main origin of CDN content which is added when creating a CDN endpoint.

name.description: Origin name which must be unique within the endpoint.

DeepCreatedOriginProperties.description: Properties of the origin created on the CDN endpoint.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. It can be a domain name, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address. This should be unique across all origins in an endpoint.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

priority.description: Priority of origin in given origin group for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority origin is healthy.Must be between 1 and 5.

weight.description: Weight of the origin in given origin group for load balancing. Must be between 1 and 1000

enabled.description: Origin is enabled for load balancing or not. By default, origin is always enabled.

privateLinkAlias.description: The Alias of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this origin is 'Private'

privateLinkResourceId.description: The Resource Id of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this backend is 'Private'

privateLinkLocation.description: The location of the Private Link resource. Required only if 'privateLinkResourceId' is populated

privateLinkApprovalMessage.description: A custom message to be included in the approval request to connect to the Private Link.

privateEndpointStatus.description: The approval status for the connection to the Private Link

DeepCreatedOriginGroup.description: The origin group for CDN content which is added when creating a CDN endpoint. Traffic is sent to the origins within the origin group based on origin health.

name.description: Origin group name which must be unique within the endpoint.

DeepCreatedOriginGroupProperties.description: Properties of the origin group created on the CDN endpoint.

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

origins.description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN within given origin group.

trafficRestorationTimeToHealedOrNewEndpo.description: Time in minutes to shift the traffic to the endpoint gradually when an unhealthy endpoint comes healthy or a new endpoint is added. Default is 10 mins. This property is currently not supported.

responseBasedOriginErrorDetectionSetting.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses.This property is currently not supported.

GeoFilter.description: Rules defining user's geo access within a CDN endpoint.

relativePath.description: Relative path applicable to geo filter. (e.g. '/mypictures', '/mypicture/kitty.jpg', and etc.)

action.description: Action of the geo filter, i.e. allow or block access.

countryCodes.description: Two letter country or region codes defining user country or region access in a geo filter, e.g. AU, MX, US.

contentPaths.description: The path to the content to be purged. Can describe a file path or a wild card directory.

keyId.description: Defines the customer defined key Id. This id will exist in the incoming request to indicate the key used to form the hash.

keySourceParameters.description: Defines the parameters for using customer key vault for Url Signing Key.

KeyVaultSigningKeyParameters.description: Describes the parameters for using a user's KeyVault for URL Signing Key.

subscriptionId.description: Subscription Id of the user's Key Vault containing the secret

resourceGroupName.description: Resource group of the user's Key Vault containing the secret

vaultName.description: The name of the user's Key Vault containing the secret

secretName.description: The name of secret in Key Vault.

secretVersion.description: The version(GUID) of secret in Key Vault.

contentPaths.description: The path to the content to be loaded. Path should be a relative file URL of the origin.

Origin.description: CDN origin is the source of the content being delivered via CDN. When the edge nodes represented by an endpoint do not have the requested content cached, they attempt to fetch it from one or more of the configured origins.

OriginProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

privateEndpointStatus.description: The approval status for the connection to the Private Link

OriginUpdateParameters.description: Origin properties needed for origin update.

OriginUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.This should be unique across all origins in an endpoint.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default. This overrides the host header defined at Endpoint

priority.description: Priority of origin in given origin group for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority origin is healthy.Must be between 1 and 5

weight.description: Weight of the origin in given origin group for load balancing. Must be between 1 and 1000

enabled.description: Origin is enabled for load balancing or not

privateLinkAlias.description: The Alias of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this origin is 'Private'

privateLinkResourceId.description: The Resource Id of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this backend is 'Private'

privateLinkLocation.description: The location of the Private Link resource. Required only if 'privateLinkResourceId' is populated

privateLinkApprovalMessage.description: A custom message to be included in the approval request to connect to the Private Link.

OriginListResult.description: Result of the request to list origins. It contains a list of origin objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of CDN origins within an endpoint

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of origin objects if there are any.

OriginGroup.description: Origin group comprising of origins is used for load balancing to origins when the content cannot be served from CDN.

OriginGroupProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin group.

resourceState.description: Resource status of the origin group.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of the origin group.

OriginGroupUpdateParameters.description: Origin group properties needed for origin group creation or update.

OriginGroupUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin group.

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

origins.description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN within given origin group.

trafficRestorationTimeToHealedOrNewEndpo.description: Time in minutes to shift the traffic to the endpoint gradually when an unhealthy endpoint comes healthy or a new endpoint is added. Default is 10 mins. This property is currently not supported.

responseBasedOriginErrorDetectionSetting.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses. This property is currently not supported.

HealthProbeParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to send health probes to origin.

probePath.description: The path relative to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

probeRequestType.description: The type of health probe request that is made.

probeProtocol.description: Protocol to use for health probe.

probeIntervalInSeconds.description: The number of seconds between health probes.Default is 240sec.

ResponseBasedOriginErrorDetectionParamet.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses.

responseBasedDetectedErrorTypes.description: Type of response errors for real user requests for which origin will be deemed unhealthy

responseBasedFailoverThresholdPercentage.description: The percentage of failed requests in the sample where failover should trigger.

httpErrorRanges.description: The list of Http status code ranges that are considered as server errors for origin and it is marked as unhealthy.

HttpErrorRangeParameters.description: The JSON object that represents the range for http status codes

begin.description: The inclusive start of the http status code range.

end.description: The inclusive end of the http status code range.

value.description: List of CDN origin groups within an endpoint

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of origin objects if there are any.

validationData.description: Special validation or data may be required when delivering CDN to some regions due to local compliance reasons. E.g. ICP license number of a custom domain is required to deliver content in China.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

resourceState.description: Resource status of the custom domain.

validationData.description: Special validation or data may be required when delivering CDN to some regions due to local compliance reasons. E.g. ICP license number of a custom domain is required to deliver content in China.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of Custom Https of the custom domain.

CustomDomainParameters.description: The customDomain JSON object required for custom domain creation or update.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

certificateSource.description: Defines the source of the SSL certificate.

protocolType.description: Defines the TLS extension protocol that is used for secure delivery.

certificateSourceParameters.description: Defines the certificate source parameters using CDN managed certificate for enabling SSL.

Operation.title: REST API Operation
Operation.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

OperationProperties.description: Properties of operation, include metric specifications.

serviceSpecification.description: One property of operation, include metric specifications.

ServiceSpecification.description: One property of operation, include log specifications.

name.description: Name of log specification.

logFilterPattern.description: Pattern to filter based on name

name.description: Name of metric specification.

unit.description: The metric unit. Possible values include: 'Bytes', 'Count', 'Milliseconds'.

aggregationType.description: The metric aggregation type. Possible values include: 'Average', 'Count', 'Total'.

availabilities.description: Retention policies of a resource metric.

supportedTimeGrainTypes.description: The supported time grain types for the metrics.

fillGapWithZero.description: Property to specify whether to fill gap with zero.

metricFilterPattern.description: Pattern to filter based on name

isInternal.description: Property to specify metric is internal or not.

DimensionProperties.description: Type of operation: get, read, delete, etc.

name.description: Name of dimension.

MetricAvailability.description: Retention policy of a resource metric.

value.description: Edge node of CDN service.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of edgenode list results if there are any.

EdgeNode.description: Edgenode is a global Point of Presence (POP) location used to deliver CDN content to end users.

EdgeNodeProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an edgenode.

deliveryRegion.description: The delivery region of the ip address group

ipv4Addresses.description: The list of ip v4 addresses.

ipv6Addresses.description: The list of ip v6 addresses.

prefixLength.description: The length of the prefix of the ip address.

QueryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

PrivateEndpointStatus.description: The approval status for the connection to the Private Link

Sku.description: The resource model definition representing SKU

name.description: The name of the SKU. E.g. P3. It is typically a letter+number code

size.description: The SKU size. When the name field is the combination of tier and some other value, this would be the standalone code.

family.description: If the service has different generations of hardware, for the same SKU, then that can be captured here.

capacity.description: If the SKU supports scale out/in then the capacity integer should be included. If scale out/in is not possible for the resource this may be omitted.

OptimizationType.description: Specifies what scenario the customer wants this CDN endpoint to optimize, e.g. Download, Media services. With this information we can apply scenario driven optimization.

migrationEndpointMappings.description: A name map between classic CDN endpoints and AFD Premium/Standard endpoints.

migratedFrom.description: Name of the classic CDN profile endpoint.

migratedTo.description: Name of the newly created migrated Azure Frontdoor Standard/Premium profile endpoint. This name will replace the name of the classic CDN endpoint resource.

AzureEntityResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager resource with an etag.

name.description: The name of the resource for which availability needs to be checked.

nameAvailable.description: Indicates if the resource name is available.

reason.description: The reason why the given name is not available.

message.description: Detailed reason why the given name is available.

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

error.description: If present, details of the operation error.

ProxyResource.title: Proxy Resource
ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a Azure Resource Manager proxy resource. It will not have tags and a location

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

name.description: The name of the resource

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

ResourceModelWithAllowedPropertySet.description: The resource model definition containing the full set of allowed properties for a resource. Except properties bag, there cannot be a top level property outside of this set.

managedBy.description: The fully qualified resource ID of the resource that manages this resource. Indicates if this resource is managed by another Azure resource. If this is present, complete mode deployment will not delete the resource if it is removed from the template since it is managed by another resource.

kind.description: Metadata used by portal/tooling/etc to render different UX experiences for resources of the same type. E.g. ApiApps are a kind of Microsoft.Web/sites type.  If supported, the resource provider must validate and persist this value.

etag.description: The etag field is *not* required. If it is provided in the response body, it must also be provided as a header per the normal etag convention.  Entity tags are used for comparing two or more entities from the same requested resource. HTTP/1.1 uses entity tags in the etag (section 14.19), If-Match (section 14.24), If-None-Match (section 14.26), and If-Range (section 14.27) header fields.

SkuTier.description: This field is required to be implemented by the Resource Provider if the service has more than one tier, but is not required on a PUT.

TrackedResource.title: Tracked Resource
TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for an Azure Resource Manager tracked top level resource which has 'tags' and a 'location'

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

encryptionProperties.description: Configuration of key for data encryption

status.description: Indicates whether or not the encryption is enabled for container registry.

locationData.description: Metadata pertaining to the geographic location of the resource.

name.description: A canonical name for the geographic or physical location.

city.description: The city or locality where the resource is located.

district.description: The district, state, or province where the resource is located.

countryOrRegion.description: The country or region where the resource is located

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.
